Package model

Class ControllerProjects

java.lang.Object
model.ControllerProjects
public class ControllerProjects extends Object
The ControllerProjects class manages a collection of Project objects. It provides methods to add projects, add stages to projects, and add capsules to stages.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ControllerProjects()
    Creates a new instance of ControllerProjects and initializes the projects array with 10 Project objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • ControllerProjects

      public ControllerProjects()
      Creates a new instance of ControllerProjects and initializes the projects array with 10 Project objects. Also calls the startBasicProjects method to initialize each project with default values.

  • Method Details

    • startBasicProjects

      public void startBasicProjects()
      Initializes each project in the projects array with default values.

    • addProject

      public void addProject(String nameProject, Calendar startDateProject, Calendar endDateProject, double budget, int[] monthStages, String greenSQAManagerName, String greenSQAManagerPhone, String companyManagerName, String companyManagerPhone)
      Adds a new Project object to the projects array with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      nameProject - The name of the project.
      startDateProject - The start date of the project as a Calendar object.
      endDateProject - The end date of the project as a Calendar object.
      budget - The budget of the project.
      monthStages - An array containing the number of months for each stage of the project.
      greenSQAManagerName - The name of the Green SQA Manager.
      greenSQAManagerPhone - The phone number of the Green SQA Manager.
      companyManagerName - The name of the Company Manager.
      companyManagerPhone - The phone number of the Company Manager.

    • culminateStage

      public Calendar culminateStage(int project, Calendar realStartNewStage)
      Calculates the end date of a stage and adds the stage to the specified project.
      Parameters:
      project - The index of the project in the projects array.
      realStartNewStage - The start date of the new stage as a Calendar object.
      Returns:
      A Calendar object representing the end date of the new stage.

    • modifyStringToCalendar

      public Calendar modifyStringToCalendar(String date) throws ParseException
      Converts a String object in the format "dd-MM-yyyy" to a Calendar object.
      Parameters:
      date - A String object representing a date in the format "dd-MM-yyyy".
      Returns:
      A Calendar object representing the date.
      Throws:
      ParseException - If the String object cannot be parsed as a date.

    • getProject

      public Project getProject(int project)
      Returns the Project object at the specified index in the projects array.
      Parameters:
      project - The index of the project in the projects array.
      Returns:
      The Project object at the specified index in the projects array.

    • getIteration

      public int getIteration()
      Returns the current iteration of the projects array
      Returns:
      the current iteration of projects array

    • checkCollaboratorExist

      public boolean checkCollaboratorExist(String name)
      This method checks whether a collaborator with the given name exists in any of the projects. It iterates through all the projects and their collaborators, comparing the name with the one given as parameter.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the collaborator to search for
      Returns:
      true if the collaborator is found in any project, false otherwise

    • checkProjectExist

      public boolean checkProjectExist(int project)
      This method checks whether a project with the given number exists. It verifies if the project name is not null in the projects array.
      Parameters:
      project - the number of the project to search for
      Returns:
      false if the project exists, true otherwise

    • checkNameCollaborator

      public boolean checkNameCollaborator(String name)
      Checks if a collaborator with the given name is already assigned to any project.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the collaborator to search for.
      Returns:
      true if a collaborator with the given name is found in any project, false otherwise.
